title: 2 v 1 are way to safe for the 2.
body:
Be it jungle camping a lane but doesn't have any real level disadvantage for said laner and jungler or the complete lack of an advantage the solo gets against a duo lane while usually being denied farm fairly well the increase in exp when it is being shared needs to go away. 

"but that will hurt supports" "exp stealing will become a thing"

And? Perhaps have support starting items have increased EXP gains when around higher level allies would make the position more interesting. Actually promoting supports to want to go to different lanes to try and apply pressure elsewhere sense it is most beneficial, it might even kill the "top lane is an island" joke that has often been all too true. This game has adapted to many changes. What is another one that alters a roll's meta away from "protect the ADC" being their primary focus? This has already somewhat happened with champs like Pyke so why not double down on it?

Split pushers are a fair criticism.

There wouldn't be more EXP given for being in lane so a split pusher would only really be a problem if they are grossly OP in 1v1 or said enemy is constantly grouped with no actual progress being made. So it will likely increase the effectiveness of split pushing and champs like Trynda who excel at it and basically nothing else might finally get reworked to address their situation.

EXP would not be given for last hits.
